team.name: Tom Voss
team.subject: Pastor
bio: Pastor Tom Voss arrived at Martin Luther in the fall of 2020. Tom was born in Milwaukee, WI, then born again into God’s family by Baptism on February 27, 1984. After spending the early years of his childhood at Mt. Olive in Lincoln, NE, his family moved to Christ Our Redeemer in Aurora, CO, being confirmed there on May 3, 1998. His pastoral training began in high school at Luther Prep School in Watertown, WI. He graduated from Martin Luther College in 2006. Tom served as a vicar (pastoral intern

Tom was assigned to serve at Holy Trinity Lutheran Church and School in the Seattle, WA area, and was ordained and installed as pastor in July of 2010. In August of 2020, Pastor accepted the call to serve at Martin Luther. In his ministry, he enjoys meeting new people, looking for every opportunity to connect people to the Word of God, and challenging God’s people to consider the true mission of the Church and how they might carry out their discipleship.

Tom and his wife Kendalyn have four young children: Josefine, Levi, Leora, and Violet. Kendalyn did her undergraduate work at UW–Madison, running track as a Badger, and obtained her Master’s in Speech–Language Pathology. She currently works in that field, doing in-home health and enjoys helping adults recover. Tom loves to golf, Kendalyn enjoys running, and the family looks for every opportunity to explore new adventures. They are excited to live and serve in Oshkosh.

team.name: John Steinbrenner
team.subject: Pastor
bio: Pastor John Steinbrenner has served at Martin Luther since July of 2024. John was born and raised in nearby Fond du Lac. After graduating from Winnebago Lutheran Academy, he briefly attended UW-Oshkosh before deciding to pursue training for the pastoral ministry. After graduating from Northwestern College in Watertown, his training continued at Wisconsin Lutheran Seminary. John was assigned to the Twin Cities, where he was ordained. A few years later, John took a call to begin an exploratory mission church in Boise, Idaho. Under his pastoral leadership, God blessed this mission with growth and Cross of Christ became an established church, which also daughtered other mission sites in the Boise area. In 2014, Pastor Steinbrenner was elected as the District President of the Pacific Northwest District, providing leadership to the district and also the Wisconsin Synod for 10 years in this role. The call to Martin Luther in 2024 gave John an opportunity to both return to the pastoral parish ministry and also be near his parents and grandchildren in this area. John is married to Carrie, and they have three adult children and three grandchildren. test
